page.title: 19A BUSINESS EXECUTIVE'S DAY
page.content: At 5.OOam the alarm reminded me of the early start necessary to catch a plane from{Manchester}to{Gothenburg}in{ {Sweden.}In{Britain}we import many things like food and electonics goods and so we must sell our products abroad to earn money. As a small part of this, I visit two{Swedish}Companies who buy parts of their trucks and cars from{England.}The flight to{Gothenburg took us over the {North Sea}where we could see ships and oil rigs below us. On arrival in{Sweden}a car took us to a large factory where the {buyers and {engineers}were waiting to meet us. The discussions with them were long and it was agreed we would start to sell to them in 3 to 4 months. We visited their works where we saw both{men and {robots}assembling huge trucks. At about 7.OOpm we travelled to{Skovde} where we spent the night.
